mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: View of main entrance at 9th Street and Baltimore Avenue

The New York Life Building in Kansas City, Mo., was designed by Frederick Elmer Hill of McKim, Mead & White as the local office of New York Life Insurance Company. It has an H-shaped footprint with a 12-story tower with 10-story wings. Above the main entrance is a sculpture of an eagle tending eaglets in the nest by Louis St. Gaudens. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_Life_Building_(Kansas_City,_Missouri) [work]
